title: The Washerman and His Ass (Trickster Structure)
central_imbalance: They get swindled by their desire for a child

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time …

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: … an elderly couple with no children of their own overhear a mullah say he can change asses into men.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: The couple have no children to pass on their savings to who would perform the last rites for them …

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: … so, they decide to ask the mullah to change their ass into a boy they can raise as their son.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: They meet the mullah and ask for his help.

beats.label: … the two characters (one is tricked or duped by the other)
beats.summary: The mullah agrees, takes their money, and tricks them with a story about the ass being changed into a qazi, and tells them to go and see him in a year and a day.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: The couple meet the qazi in the marketplace (presenting the ass’s halter and nosebag to him, and asking him to be their son).

beats.label: … the two characters (the previously duped character tricks the other)
beats.summary: The qazi calmly accepts the halter and nosebag; he asks to speak to them in private. (Transformational Twist/Comic step).

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: The qazi sees the situation as curious rather than humiliating.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: He makes a plan which involves telling them that he was their ass, but that he's reformed now.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: He tells them that he will perform the last rites for them if they will keep his story a secret.

beats.label: … the two characters (one is tricked or duped by the other)
beats.summary: The couple agree to the qazi’s conditions, and give him all their wealth. (Transformational Twist/Comic step).

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: Time passes (the couple die).

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: The qazi performs the last rites for them.

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: … which ends in the qazi’s reputation remaining unscathed, with them being buried respectfully when they die, with the qazi inheriting their wealth, and with the mullah being very disappointed.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Hsün Chü-po Visits His Friend (Trickster Variation Structure)
central_imbalance: feels the rules are rigged; wants to flip the script

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation (set-up: who, when, where – two characters on different quests)
beats.summary: Hsun Chü-po

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: … had a friend who was ill.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: He travelled a great distance to see him. They converse.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: Hsun Chü-po and the Tartars meet

beats.label: … the two characters which sets up a cognitive dissonance (**trickster awe step**)
beats.summary: Hsun Chü-po tells the Tartars to spare his life and take his instead. The Tartars order Hsun Chü-Po to leave.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: … the two characters which resolves the cognitive dissonance (**transformational twist**)
beats.summary: At this, the Tartars marvelled. "Indeed, we are iniquitous men who have come to the land of the righteous." So they gathered their troops and departed …

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: … and the prefecture was saved from destruction.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: The Story of Cornix (Transformation Structure)
central_imbalance: Creeped on by some jerk

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time ….

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: … Cornix ….

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: … was chased by Neptune … (Represents the transgression against the natural order).

beats.label: resolution
beats.summary: … but was saved by Minerva … (Represents the restoration of equilibrium).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: … who transformed Cornix into a white crow. [Cornix lived like that …].

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: … from then on.

title: Lazy Jack (Trickster Structure)
central_imbalance: Jack is way too lazy. he never quite “gets it.”

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time ….

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: … Jack ….

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: … his mother wanted him to be self-supporting, but his actions failed to meet the mark.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: … so she sent him to work.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: … he met his employer, received payment.

beats.label: … the two characters (one is tricked or duped by the other)
beats.summary: He subsequently wasted the goods (Trickster/Comic step, repeated five times).

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: He met the deaf and dumb girl while carrying the donkey over his shoulder.

beats.label: … the two characters (the previously duped character tricks the other)
beats.summary: She laughed, was cured, and married him (Transformational Twist/Comic step).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: They ended up married.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: … and lived happily together.

title: The Three Little Pigs (Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: wants something they don’t have and has to go after it

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied].

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Pigs needed to leave home/find shelter.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: They needed protection from the wolf.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: They built their houses.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: They met their friend/helper (Rex, the third pig).

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: The stronger house helped them resist the wolf.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: They met the enemy/hindrance (the wolf’s attempt to enter the brick house).

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: They defeated the wolf (by boiling him in the pot).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: They lived safely ever after.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied].

title: Nasr-el-Din Hodja and the Walnut Tree (Quest Structure)

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time …

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Nasr-el-Din Hodja lay under a walnut tree to rest.

beats.label: problem (unfortunately)
beats.summary: His mind was troubled; he questioned why Allah paired a big tree with small walnuts.

beats.label: journey (fortunately)
beats.summary: Hodja had an idea for a better arrangement of pumpkins and walnuts.

beats.label: meeting with … (unfortunately)
beats.summary: Sleep came to him before he could follow this train of thought further.

beats.label: … friend/helper (fortunately)
beats.summary: A walnut fell on him from the tree and woke him up.

beats.label: meeting with … (unfortunately)
beats.summary: He realised that if his scheme were true, he would have been killed.

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance (fortunately)
beats.summary: He realised there was a good reason why things were the way they were.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: And he never questioned the wisdom of Allah …

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: … ever again.

title: The Wolf in The Three Wee Pigs (Trickster Structure)
central_imbalance: The wolf is always hungry

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: A wolf …

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: … was hungry [implied] …

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: … so he went off in search of food … [implied]

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: … and when he was brought short by three doors in turn, behind which he could sense increasing numbers of pigs …

beats.label: … one is tricked or duped by the other
beats.summary: … he dissembled at the first two, and asked to be let in; and tried to get into the third via the chimney.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: Although he blew the first houses in, almost managed to eat the first two pigs and almost managed to gain entry to the third house, …

beats.label: … the two characters (the previously duped character tricks the other)
beats.summary: … the three pigs always managed to get the better of him …

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: … and he met a tragic end which allowed the pigs to live out their lives in peace and quiet.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Sleeping Beauty (Death and Rebirth Structure)
central_imbalance: Aurora was born from a wish.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time …

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: … a royal couple …

beats.label: problem (lack)
beats.summary: … lack a child.

beats.label: lack fulfilled
beats.summary: Their wish is granted … they celebrate …

beats.label: reversal/price to pay
beats.summary: … but the price for their good fortune is exacted when a fairy curses the princess.

beats.label: attempts to avoid paying the price
beats.summary: They try to avoid paying the price, but fail.

beats.label: submersion
beats.summary: She falls asleep.

beats.label: nested quest structure involving saviour character starts
beats.summary: Time passes. (The prince goes on a quest.)

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: She is woken by the prince’s kiss, and they marry …

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: … bringing the story to an end …

title: Cinderella (Rags to Riches Structure)
central_imbalance: overlooked and sidelined; wants a real shot

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time...

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: A family

beats.label: positive condition
beats.summary: live together happily, until...

beats.label: problem (reversal)
beats.summary: Her mother dies, and her father remarries; she is ill-treated, resulting in a state of subversion. This state leaves her to be treated badly by her stepmother and two ugly stepsisters.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: Meanwhile, a prince, needing a wife, decides to invite all eligible young women to the ball to choose a royal bride.

beats.label: journey thwarted, meeting with …
beats.summary: The family are invited, but Cinderella's stepmother and stepsisters refuse to allow her to attend. ).

beats.label: ... friend /helper
beats.summary: ... friend /helper

beats.label: reversion to previous state in an altered state of consciousness
beats.summary: ... but it doesn't last. She returns to her state of subversion, but with the hope embodied by the lost slipper (nested Quest structure involving a Saviour character starts).

beats.label: nested quest
beats.summary: The prince goes on a Quest to find the mysterious guest, using the item to help him. which ultimately, despite machinations..

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: restores Cinderella to her happy state (and in some versions) punishes the evildoers who wnanted to pervertthe course of justice..

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: enabling the couple to live happily ever after.

title: The Story of Medusa (Transformation Structure)
central_imbalance: She was too beautiful

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Medusa, known for her beauty.

beats.label: transgression against the natural order
beats.summary: Neptune violates Medusa in Minerva’s temple.

beats.label: restoration of natural order
beats.summary: Minerva intervenes and punishes the transgression.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: Medusa is transformed into a Gorgon with snakes for hair.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: When Goha Lost His Donkey (Trickster Structure)
central_imbalance: Just vibing

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Once upon a time ….

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: … Goha ….

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: … lost his donkey ….

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: … so he went to look for it.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: Meeting a man on the way, Goha asked the man whether he’d seen it.

beats.label: … one is tricked or duped by the other (trickster/comic step)
beats.summary: “I’ve seen the donkey officiating as a judge,” came the reply.

beats.label: meeting between …
beats.summary: Goha processed the response ….

beats.label: … the two characters (the previously duped character tricks the other) (transformational twist)
beats.summary: … and answered, “I knew he’d be a Cadi … when I taught him philosophy, I noticed his ears weren’t sewed up”.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: [The story is left unresolved].

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [The story is left open-ended].

title: Snow White (Death and Rebirth Structure)
central_imbalance: She was granted her mom's dying wish.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Snow White is born.

beats.label: problem (lack)
beats.summary: The Queen (her mother) dies, and she is threatened by the Evil Queen.

beats.label: lack fulfilled
beats.summary: Her mother's wish is granted; she grows up beautiful.

beats.label: reversal/price to pay
beats.summary: The Evil Queen attempts to kill her.

beats.label: attempts to avoid paying the price
beats.summary: She escapes and is hidden by the dwarfs.

beats.label: submersion
beats.summary: She falls into a death-like sleep after eating the poisoned apple.

beats.label: nested quest structure involving saviour character starts
beats.summary: Time passes. The Prince finds her coffin.

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: She is revived by the Prince and they marry.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Neptune's Quest in The Story of Cornix (Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: neptune is always horny

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Neptune is driven by lust (Problem implied in state).

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He is enamoured by Cornix.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: He uses flattery and entreaties (his "friends and helpers") to win her over.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: He tries to use force.

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: [Implied: His attempt initially helps him reach his goal].

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: Cornix cries out for help (meeting the challenge/hindrance).

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: Minerva intervenes, thwarting his desires.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: Cornix is transformed into a crow; his quest is defeated.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: The Academic Essay (Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: the student/writer has a question to tackle and prove

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Introduction (Setting the stage for inquiry).

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Topic and context defined.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: Identifying the question or issue to be resolved.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: Thesis (The main argument/solution proposed).

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: Evidence (Gathering supporting data/sources).

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: Analysis (Interpreting the evidence to support the thesis).

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: Arguments against the point of view (The 'Wolf'/Enemy/Hindrance).

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: Counter-arguments and defeat of opposing views (Sound Reasoning).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: Conclusion (Outcome/Resolution of the central question).

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: Implications and close.

title: The Gigantic Turnip (Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: he's got a turnip that's way too big

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: implied

beats.label: initial situation (set-up: who, when, where)
beats.summary: A grandfather planted a turnip seed.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He couldn’t pull up the turnip….

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: … so he called his grandmother to help him.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: … but his grandmother couldn’t pull it up either.

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: … so they called the granddaughter….

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: … but the granddaughter couldn’t pull it up either.

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: … helped them pull up the turnip. (Note: The hindrance is overcome by the accumulated help, enabling the resolution).

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: … enabling the grandfather to harvest it.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: implied.

title: The Story of Narcissus (Transformation Structure)
central_imbalance: narcissus only loves himself

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Narcissus (A beautiful mortal maiden)

beats.label: transgression against the natural order
beats.summary: Narcissus turns his feelings inwards, transgressing against love.

beats.label: restoration of natural order
beats.summary: He is compelled to gaze lovingly at his reflection (the curse/punishment).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: He is changed into a flower.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Inverse Rags to Riches / Rich to Rags (Death and Rebirth Structure)
central_imbalance: the billionaire thinks money = happiness

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: The billionaire.

beats.label: problem (lack)
beats.summary: He lacks love and meaningful existence.

beats.label: lack fulfilled
beats.summary: He tries to find fulfilment through material pursuits (giving away wealth, pursuing hobbies).

beats.label: reversal/price to pay
beats.summary: He fails to sustain a lasting relationship.

beats.label: attempts to avoid paying the price
beats.summary: He keeps trying to pursue love and spirituality.

beats.label: submersion
beats.summary: His cynicism and materialism close off the path to meaning.

beats.label: nested quest structure involving saviour character starts
beats.summary: [Implied: He looks for a way out or resolution].

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: He remains his own worst enemy and closes off the option for a meaningful existence.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied: The tragedy is complete].

title: The Day the Lights Went Out (Tragic Death and Rebirth Structure)
central_imbalance: jean is fragile, her health slipping away, can’t hold onto life

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Jean in her apartment, experiencing a brief moment of beauty.

beats.label: problem (lack)
beats.summary: Jean is sick and suffering from a health problem.

beats.label: lack fulfilled
beats.summary: The promise of summer is present. (Represents the initial granting of life/wish fulfillment).

beats.label: reversal/price to pay
beats.summary: She goes into a coma.

beats.label: attempts to avoid paying the price
beats.summary: The medical staff intervene, trying to help.

beats.label: submersion
beats.summary: Time passes.

beats.label: nested quest structure involving saviour character starts
beats.summary: The medical staff do their best (Saviour Quest in progress).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: They fail to save her, and Jean dies.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Paul’s Journey (Tragic Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: paul wants meaning but keeps colliding with fate and failure

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Paul, suffering from migraines.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He is unable to go out due to his illness.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: He attempts various remedies to get better.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: He meets inanimate objects/activities (e.g., puzzles, books).

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: The objects/activities temporarily alleviate his pain.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: His internal struggle prevents him from going outside (his unwitting self-sabotage/enemy).

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance (tragic step)
beats.summary: He commits suicide, putting an end to his unhappiness, but tragically forfeiting the chance to recover.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: His story ends with silence.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Voyage and Return Structure (Sinbad the Sailor)
central_imbalance: needs to get out there and come back with something to show for it

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Sinbad, having wasted his inheritance.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He needs to earn money to survive.

beats.label: journey/translation
beats.summary: He sets out on a sea voyage (translation to a different dimension of being).

beats.label: problem (of return)
beats.summary: His ship is wrecked, leaving him stranded.

beats.label: return/resolution
beats.summary: He overcomes the initial challenge (e.g., finding land/resources).

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He encounters monsters or grave perils.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: He uses cunning and luck to survive (engaging helpers).

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: He faces the physical difficulty of travel or transport.

beats.label: return/resolution
beats.summary: He finds a means to return home (e.g., a merchant ship).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: He returns to Baghdad, transformed by the experience.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: The Moon and His Two Wives (Perpetual Motion Structure)
central_imbalance: Why does the moon wax and wane?

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: character(s) emerge(s)
beats.summary: The Moon (and Sun/Wives, implied in the cycle).

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: The Moon is at its fullest (excess/problem of weight gain).

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: The Sun's knife cuts the Moon away. (The Moon is forced to lose substance).

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: Only a tiny piece is left (state of extreme lack).

beats.label: journey/resolution
beats.summary: The Moon gradually grows again.

beats.label: unfolding proceeds
beats.summary: [And continues to unfold in perpetuo $\dots$].

title: The Story of Arachne (Transformation Structure)
central_imbalance: Arachne's way too good at weaving.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Arachne, renowned for her weaving skill.

beats.label: transgression against the natural order
beats.summary: Arachne refuses to acknowledge Minerva and depicts divine transgressions on her tapestry.

beats.label: restoration of natural order
beats.summary: Minerva strikes Arachne and transforms her.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: Arachne is consigned to spinning webs (restored order, but permanently altered).

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Rai San’yō Poem (Ki-Shō-Ten-Ketsu Structure)
central_imbalance: People survive differently.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: introduction ($\text{ki}$): ‘to rise/start’
beats.summary: Introduction of the two daughters of Itoya.

beats.label: development ($\text{shō}$): ‘to continue’
beats.summary: Detailing the ages of the two daughters.

beats.label: twist ($\text{ten}$): ‘to turn/change’
beats.summary: Introduction of a strong contrast (Generals killing with weapons).

beats.label: synthesis ($\text{ketsu}$): ‘to unite/join’
beats.summary: Resolution of the contrast (Daughters kill suitors with eyes).

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: The Annunciation to Mary (Call and Response Variation 2)
central_imbalance: Mary is in doubt of her faith.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Mary.

beats.label: quest structure problem / revelation structure rumour/doubt ($\text{veni}$ step)
beats.summary: She is troubled by the Angel's greeting, prompting doubt.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: She asks how the event is possible.

beats.label: meeting with … / verification: confirmation/refutation ($\text{vidi}$ step)
beats.summary: The Angel provides an explanation.

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: The explanation is accepted (Confirmation).

beats.label: meeting with … / assertion/denial ($\text{vici}$ step)
beats.summary: Mary agrees, cancelling her doubt.

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: The Resolution step.

beats.label: state of lack / transformation structure (with resolution not achieved)
beats.summary: The event is set in motion (The lack of the child is now being addressed).

beats.label: state of excess
beats.summary: The continuing unfolding of the events (e.g., the Nativity), leading to an excessive state of good.

beats.label: final situation (outcome/resolution)
beats.summary: [Implied Resolution].

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied].

title: The Wife's Capture in *Go I Know Not Whither* (Call and Response Variation 1)
central_imbalance: A hunter injures a magical bird.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: The magical bird is introduced (metaphysical state).

beats.label: state of lack / transgression
beats.summary: Fedot captures the bird and wounds her (an excessive act of evil/transgression).

beats.label: state of excess / restoration
beats.summary: The bird-wife accepts Fedot and transforms into a maiden (Transformation resolution).

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: She marries Fedot.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: The Ghazal Poetic Form (Perpetual Motion Structure)
central_imbalance: Maintaining a balance of rhythm

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: character(s) emerge(s)
beats.summary: The poetic form (the Ghazal) is introduced.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: The first line (A) sets up an expectation (for the rhyme).

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: The second line (A) fulfills the expectation.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: The third line (B) sets up a new expectation (for the following rhyme).

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: The fourth line (A) fulfills the expectation.

beats.label: unfolding proceeds
beats.summary: The cycle of expectation and fulfillment continues.

title: The Koan Structure (The Sound of One Hand Clapping)
central_imbalance: What is wisdom?

beats.label: paradoxical opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: koan presented
beats.summary: The known situation is stated (two hands clapping).

beats.label: paradox which sets up a cognitive dissonance
beats.summary: The unanswerable question is posed (one hand clapping).

beats.label: resolution of paradox leading to enlightenment
beats.summary: The cognitive dissonance is resolved through insight/enlightenment (unmarked state).

beats.label: paradoxical closing
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: Beowulf: Heorot and Grendel's Emergence (Call and Response Variation 1)
central_imbalance: The vibes are too good.

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: Listen! (Hwæt)

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: King Hrothgar and the lineage of kings introduced.

beats.label: transgression against the natural order
beats.summary: Hrothgar wishes to build a hall of extreme renown.

beats.label: an (excessive) attempt to restore the natural order is made
beats.summary: The hall (Heorot) is built and becomes a site of feasting and merrymaking (excess of good).

beats.label: quest structure problem / revelation structure rumour/doubt ($\text{veni}$ step)
beats.summary: Grendel is summoned by the noise/excess.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: Grendel goes toward the hall.

beats.label: meeting with … / verification: confirmation/refutation ($\text{vidi}$ step)
beats.summary: Grendel sees the hall with his own eyes (suspicions confirmed).

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: Grendel leaves with spoils/conquers the hall (vici step).

title: Grendel’s Initial Attack (Revelation Structure)
central_imbalance: The vibes are too good.

beats.label: doubt ($\text{veni}$ step)
beats.summary: Grendel senses the revelry (rumour/doubt).

beats.label: verification: confirmation/refutation ($\text{vidi}$ step)
beats.summary: Grendel sees the hall (verification).

beats.label: assertion/denial ($\text{vici}$ step)
beats.summary: Grendel conquers (the static outcome).

title: Huainanzi Linchpin Analogy (Ki-Shō-Ten-Ketsu Structure)
central_imbalance: Does the inner match the outer?

beats.label: [opening]
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: introduction ($\text{ki}$)
beats.summary: Valuing outer refinement vs. inner substance.

beats.label: development ($\text{shō}$)
beats.summary: Outer refinement must not overwhelm inner substance.

beats.label: twist ($\text{ten}$)
beats.summary: Analogy of the chariot linchpin (external function versus internal requirement).

beats.label: synthesis ($\text{ketsu}$)
beats.summary: The Superior Man acts, thinking about the results.

beats.label: [closing]
beats.summary: [Implied]

title: African Dyola Story (Dilemma Structure)
central_imbalance: They suddenly get thirsty

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Two hunters in the forest.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: They suddenly become thirsty.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: They decide to seek water and the means to carry it.

beats.label: crossroads/paradox
beats.summary: Water gushes forth instantly, and the bucket appears instantly.

beats.label: dilemma posed
beats.summary: **Which man was the most worthy?** (This becomes the Story Seekers' problem).

beats.label: story seekers' problem
beats.summary: The audience/seekers try to find a solution (Quest initiated).

beats.label: seekers' journey/resolution
beats.summary: Discussion and collective reasoning are used.

beats.label: resolution presented
beats.summary: Seekers present their answer to the spinner.

beats.label: eventual resolution
beats.summary: Consensus is reached, linking to the social order.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: A new state of balance in the social order.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied].

title: Orpheus and Eurydice (Quest Structure)
central_imbalance: He is suddenly left alone

beats.label: opening
beats.summary: [Implied]

beats.label: initial situation
beats.summary: Orpheus, devoted to Eurydice.

beats.label: problem
beats.summary: Eurydice dies and is taken to the Underworld.

beats.label: journey
beats.summary: Orpheus resolves to travel to the Underworld.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: He meets Hades and Persephone.

beats.label: … friend/helper
beats.summary: His music charms them into releasing Eurydice.

beats.label: meeting with …
beats.summary: He is given the condition (not to look back/self-hindrance).

beats.label: … enemy/hindrance
beats.summary: Orpheus fails the test by looking back, losing her forever.

beats.label: final situation
beats.summary: Orpheus returns, defeated; the problem is tragically unresolved.

beats.label: closing
beats.summary: [Implied]
